cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (100 km) south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move west-northwest into the east-central Gulf of Mexico, turn northwest, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend around Thursday, then accelerate northeastward and move offshore of the GA/SC/NC coasts by late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend), then coastal GA, SC, and southern NC as the system exits to the Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low risk of tropical-storm-force winds (≤3% probability) late Fri–early Sat; breezy conditions possible as system passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected given track stays southeast of Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible late week; significant totals (>4 in) unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, long-period swells and possible port approach restrictions Friday–Saturday.
